vulnerabilities.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: Application reflects user input without proper encoding. Vulnerable contexts: Potential XSS. Example payload: <script>alert(1)</script>
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement context-aware output encoding. Use Content Security Policy (CSP). Sanitize user input. Use frameworks with auto-escaping.

evidence.response:

<html lang="en">

    <title>FileShr - Secure File Sharing Platform</title>
    <script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com"></script>
    <script>

vulnerabilities.title: Potential SQL Injection Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: Application returns database error messages when special characters are used.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Use parameterized queries/prepared statements. Never concatenate user input into SQL queries.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing X-Frame-Options Header
vulnerabilities.description: The X-Frame-Options header is not set, making the site vulnerable to clickjacking attacks.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "X-Frame-Options: DENY" or "X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN" header to all responses.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Content-Security-Policy Header
vulnerabilities.description: No Content Security Policy detected. CSP helps prevent XSS and data injection attacks.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement a Content-Security-Policy header with appropriate directives for your application.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Strict-Transport-Security Header
vulnerabilities.description: HSTS header not found. Site may be vulnerable to protocol downgrade attacks.

vulnerabilities.title: Cookie Missing Secure Flag
vulnerabilities.description: Cookies are set without the Secure flag, allowing transmission over unencrypted connections.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "Secure" flag to all cookies: Set-Cookie: name=value; Secure

vulnerabilities.title: Cookie Missing SameSite Attribute
vulnerabilities.description: Cookies lack SameSite attribute, vulnerable to CSRF attacks.

vulnerabilities.title: Input Reflection Detected - SQL Injection Pattern
vulnerabilities.description: User input "'" is reflected in the response without proper encoding.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement proper input validation and output encoding. Use context-aware escaping.

vulnerabilities.title: Input Reflection Detected - XSS Pattern
vulnerabilities.description: User input "<script>" is reflected in the response without proper encoding.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement proper input validation and output encoding. Use context-aware escaping.

vulnerabilities.title: Sensitive Endpoints Discovered
vulnerabilities.remediation: Restrict access to administrative interfaces. Remove development/debug files. Use .htaccess or firewall rules.

evidence.response:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Admin Login - FileShr</title>
    <script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com"></script>
    <link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
    <link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin>
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@300;400;500;600;700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">

vulnerabilities.title: Missing X-Content-Type-Options Header
vulnerabilities.description: Missing header allows MIME-sniffing which could lead to security vulnerabilities.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add "X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff" header to all responses.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Referrer-Policy Header
vulnerabilities.description: No Referrer-Policy set. Sensitive information in URLs may leak to third parties.

vulnerabilities.title: Server Version Disclosure
vulnerabilities.description: Server header reveals version information: nginx/1.26.3
vulnerabilities.remediation: Configure server to hide version information in Server header.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Permissions-Policy Header
vulnerabilities.description: No Permissions-Policy header found. Browser features not explicitly controlled.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Add Permissions-Policy header to control browser features like geolocation, camera, etc.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing X-XSS-Protection Header
vulnerabilities.description: Legacy XSS protection header not set (still used by older browsers).

vulnerabilities.title: Certificate Expiration Check
vulnerabilities.remediation: Monitor certificate expiration and renew before expiry.
